headline: Rep. Gosar introduces bill to ban gun lists by feds
author: Tom Knighton
sentences: “In its latest attempt to keep track of all law-abiding gun-owners and implement its unconstitutional gun control agenda, the Biden administration has ordered the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) create a gun owner database of almost a billion searchable records, prohibited by current federal law.

My No Gun Lists Act would require the ATF to immediately eliminate their illegal firearm record repository system, prohibit the relisting of records, and allow gun owners to sue the ATF for damages and injunctive relief,” said Congressman Paul Gosar.
After all, even if you opt not to exercise your Second Amendment rights, you shouldn’t be fine with the government keeping a list of your neighbors who have decided otherwise.
In just the past year, the ATF has stockpiled the records of over 54 million legal gun owners according to a troubling document first reported by the Washington Free Beacon.
The ATF is violating existing federal law regarding record keeping and there is concern that passing another law prohibiting record keeping will not stop the ATF.
Well, for one thing, it’s a signal that we’re not going to stop fighting for our gun rights just because Democrats have control of Congress and the White House.
While I’d love to see it become law, I really don’t think we’re going to see that and, even if we do, there’s little reason to believe it’ll change anything.
